pages.text: All 16 vanilla $(thing)Dye Colors$() can be obtained as items. Most flowers and other colorful plants can be ground into dye using a $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$(). Powders of $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals)metal ores$() can be crafted directly into dye. $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#graphite)Graphite$(), $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#kaolinite)Kaolinite$(), $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#sylvite)Sylvite$(), $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#lapis_lazuli)Lapis$(), Coke, and Charcoal powder can be crafted into dye as well.

pages.title: Dye Liquids
pages.text: Dyes can also be made into fluids. A dye item and 1000mB of $(item)Water$() boiled in a $(l:mechanics/pot)Pot$() produces the same amount of $(thing)Dye Fluid$(). Dye fluids are used in $(l:mechanics/barrels)Barrels$() to color items.
Dyeing items in a barrel is cheaper than using items, requiring only 25mB of dyed fluid.
Dye fluids can be used to finish $(item)Music Discs$().
Dye fluids can even dye leather as if it were crafted!
Five $(item)Wood Ash$() and 1000mB of $(item)Water$() boiled in a $(l:mechanics/pot)Pot$() produces lye. 25mB of Lye removes the color from a colored item.

$(li)$(item)Black Dye$() is used for $(l:mechanics/scribing_table)Scribing Tables$().$(li)$(item)Red Dye$() is used for $(l:mechanics/powderkegs)Powderkegs$(). $(li)Unfired $(l:mechanics/decay#small_vessels)Small Vessels$() and $(l:mechanics/decay#large_vessels)Large Vessels$() can be dyed$().
